intro: Meryta gracilis, commonly known as the slender meryta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. Meryta gracilis is often found in coastal and lowland habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
